news_title: Nurses Month Member Spotlight: Taylor Diani, MBA, MSN, RN, Director Clinical Care, Medical Affairs
news_content: May is National Nurses Month, a time to honor and celebrate the incredible work of nurses. HIMSS is celebrating its members who are on the front lines every day. What is the organization of your employment? BD What is your current position? Director Clinical Care, Medical Affairs Tell us more about your background. My background includes 20 years of diverse nursing experience through which my role in nursing has grown from a certified nursing assistant to a master prepared nurse. I now serve in a unique role as a medical affairs leader at BD. Immediately prior to joining BD, I served as the Senior Director of Strategic Program Development at CommonSpirit where I led various specialty programs and technology adoption. My most recent education was completed at Johns Hopkins University where I earned dual master's degrees in nursing and business administration. The dual master's program at JHU provided me the unique opportunity to collaborate with leaders from Stanford Healthcare, Dartmouth Health and the University of California San Diego Health. My professional organization involvement includes HIMSS, AONL, ANA, ANCL, and AORN. Can you share a significant milestone or time you are most proud of within your career? Serving in a leadership role through the COVID pandemic served as a significant milestone in my career. The experience helped to shape me as a nursing leader as I navigated the adversity of the pandemic and learned what it truly means to be resilient, courageous, and compassionate. Within your profession, what do you hope to accomplish in the future? My personal mission is to continue to advocate for the nursing profession and practice at the national and global level. Through collaboration and partnership with leaders across the globe, I aim to arm nurses with the tools necessary to deliver high quality care. In your opinion, what actions or initiatives do you believe would be most effective in fostering a culture of recognition and appreciation for nurses, not only during Nurses Month but throughout the entire year? Nurses are the heart of health care, and it is important that they are well represented professionally. Nurses want to be heard; therefore, it is important to provide them with opportunities to share their insight and provide feedback thereby ultimately giving them a seat at the proverbial table. Nurses Month is sponsored by BD. Join Us as We Reimagine Health Through Information and Technology At HIMSS, our vision is to realize the full health potential of every human, everywhere. Be part of the community that’s transforming the global health ecosystem with courage, curiosity and determination. Be part of what’s next for health
news_summary: May is National Nurses Month, celebrating the vital work of nurses. HIMSS honors its members on the front lines. A Director of Clinical Care at BD shares her 20-year nursing journey, highlighting her leadership during the COVID pandemic and her dual master's degrees from Johns Hopkins University. She aims to advocate for the nursing profession globally and believes in giving nurses a voice. Nurses Month is sponsored by BD, and HIMSS encourages participation in transforming global health.

news_title: Health and Tech Experts Invited to Shape the Future of Healthcare at HIMSS25
news_content: HIMSS is calling all thought leaders to make their mark on the HIMSS Global Health Conference and Exhibition, the largest healthcare technology conference in the world. HIMSS has officially opened the call for proposals and the call for reviewers for HIMSS25 , taking place March 3-6, 2025, in Las Vegas. Speakers and reviewers have a chance to guide the tens of thousands of healthcare changemakers — including public health officials, CIOs and CTOs, informaticists, data scientists and practitioners — who attend the conference each year. Nearly 500 speakers presented general education sessions at HIMSS24 to more than 30,000 professionals representing more than 70 countries . Experts in areas such as artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, interoperability, workforce development and more are once again invited to lead the future of healthcare. Anyone interested in presenting critical advancements and best practices at the 2025 conference is invited to submit a proposal for a HIMSS25 general education session. Proposals are peer reviewed, scored and selected by members of the HIMSS Global Health Conference Education Committee. The deadline to submit session proposals is June 10, 2024. Learn more about submitting a proposal for HIMSS25. HIMSS members are also invited to help shape the global conference by applying to review and recommend submitted proposals. The peer-review process enhances efficiency and maximizes the quality of education offered to conference attendees. More than 200 subject matter experts are selected to be reviewers. The deadline to apply to be a reviewer is May 30, 2024. Only HIMSS members can serve as reviewers. Learn more about becoming a reviewer for HIMSS25 and become a HIMSS member today to join the global health transformation. Join Us as We Reimagine Health Through Information and Technology At HIMSS, our vision is to realize the full health potential of every human, everywhere. Be part of the community that’s transforming the global health ecosystem with courage, curiosity and determination. Become a HIMSS member
news_summary: HIMSS has opened the call for proposals and reviewers for the HIMSS25 Global Health Conference and Exhibition, scheduled for March 3-6, 2025, in Las Vegas. The event invites thought leaders in healthcare technology to guide attendees, including public health officials, CIOs, CTOs, and data scientists. Proposals for general education sessions are due by June 10, 2024, and reviewer applications by May 30, 2024. HIMSS members are encouraged to participate in shaping the conference's educational content.
